body:
@bcmills The question is why introduce a language level feature when the problem is a package management one. Especially since any new feature has the capacity of being misused.

It's probable that another solution exists/could be found in terms of importing logic that doesn't involve aliases.

If you consider a package as a function which may take as input a package and returns Exports, the goal is to transform a single input function into a multiple input one.
That is not possible unless one uses an indirection.

For refactoring, why not introduce refactored packages then? In other terms, package level aliasing ?

This is just an idea that is not reallly formalized. But I think that the current proposal is not right as it is.
